debug.description: Print debug messages with the type and value of 0-10 different inputs. This is useful for checking the values of input data or the outputs of other playbook blocks.
debug.label: debug
debug.name: debug

list_zip.description: This function zips two or more lists together to create a list of equal length. This can be useful when multiple upstream blocks are used for a single downstream block with multiple inputs. A maximum of 8 lists can be zipped together. The input lists are intended to be flat lists of strings, not nested lists or dictionaries.

fields.description: (Optional) 'longest' OR 'shortest'. Defaults to 'shortest'. Determines how to treat lists of unequal size. Longest will pad the merged list to the longest of all of the lists. Shortest will truncate the merged list to the shortest of all of the lists.
fields.label: zip_type
fields.name: zip_type

fields.description: (Optional) True OR False. Defaults to True. Determines if an input with a single value should be duplicated in the zipped list.
fields.label: pad_values
fields.name: pad_values

24.userCode:
# Write your custom code here...
    threat_list__threat_list = []
    
    for i in range(len(run_query_1_result_item_0)):
        for threat_object_type, threat_object in zip(run_query_1_result_item_0, run_query_1_result_item_1):
            threat_list_tuple = []
            threat_list_tuple.append(threat_object_type)
            threat_list_tuple.append(threat_object)
        threat_list__threat_list[i] = threat_list_tuple
            
    phantom.debug(threat_list__threat_list)

query.template:
datamodel:Risk 
| search normalized_risk_object="{0}" risk_object_type="{3}" 
| where _time>={1} AND _time<={2}  | eval risk_event_id = if(isnull(risk_event_id), index + "_" + _cd + "_" + splunk_server, risk_event_id) | eventstats count by risk_event_id | where count < 2 
| eval risk_message=coalesce(risk_message,source) 
| eval threat_zip = mvzip(threat_object, threat_object_type) 
| rename annotations.mitre_attack.mitre_technique_id as mitre_technique_id annotations.mitre_attack.mitre_tactic as mitre_tactic annotations.mitre_attack.mitre_technique as mitre_technique 
| fields - annotations* orig_sid orig_rid risk_factor* splunk_server host sourcetype tag threat_object* 
| stats list(risk_event_id) as risk_event_ids list(_time) as original_timestamps count as _event_count sum(calculated_risk_score) as _total_risk_score earliest(_time) as earliest latest(_time) as latest values(*) as * by search_name risk_message 
| where NOT (match(source, "Splunk\sSOAR") AND _total_risk_score<=0) 
| fields mitre* _event_count _total_risk_score original_timestamps threat_zip risk_event_ids threat_object
    [| rest /services/datamodel/model 
    | search eai:acl.app IN (Splunk_SA_CIM, SA-IdentityManagement, SA-NetworkProtection, SA-ThreatIntelligence, DA-ESS-ThreatIntelligence) 
    | fields description 
    | spath input=description path=objects{{}}.fields{{}}.fieldName 
    | spath input=description path=objects{{}}.calculations{{}}.outputFields{{}}.fieldName 
    | eval fieldNames=mvappend('objects{{}}.fields{{}}.fieldName', 'objects{{}}.calculations{{}}.outputFields{{}}.fieldName') 
    | stats values(fieldNames) as fieldNames 
    | mvexpand fieldNames 
    | regex fieldNames="^[_a-z]+$" 
    | stats values(fieldNames) as search] 
| sort + latest 
| `uitime(earliest)` 
| `uitime(latest)` 
| eval _time=latest 
| rex field=threat_zip "(?<threat_object>.*)\,(?<threat_object_type>.*)" 
| fields - threat_zip
